RG Kar rape case verdict live: Judgment today by Kolkata court, victim's kin say ‘more involved’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
RG Kar rape case verdict: BJP alleges evidence was 'tampered'

Publication Date: January 18, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

On January 18, 2025, a court in Kolkata found Sanjay Roy guilty of the rape-murder of a 31-year-old trainee doctor, whose body was discovered in the RG Kar Medical College & Hospital seminar hall on August 9, 2024. The ruling has raised concerns over the investigation, with allegations of evidence tampering from various political representatives.

  • The body of a trainee doctor was found dead in RG Kar Medical College on August 9, 2024.
  • Sanjay Roy, a civic volunteer, was arrested shortly after the incident, following CCTV footage linking him to the crime.
  • The case led to widespread protests by junior doctors demanding justice and better safety measures.
  • The trial began on November 12, 2024, with a total of 50 witnesses presented.
“The court has convicted him (Sanjay Roy), but the people of West Bengal believe that more than one person may have been involved in the incident.” - Sukanta Majumdar, Union Minister

The court is set to determine Sanjay Roy's sentence on January 20, 2025, amidst calls from the public for the maximum possible punishment.
newTitle: RG Kar rape case verdict: BJP alleges evidence was 'tampered'

Rohit Sharma has announced his availability for the Ranji Trophy match scheduled from January 23-26 against Jammu & Kashmir, marking his return to domestic cricket after nearly ten years.

  • Rohit's last Ranji match was in November 2015, at the same Wankhede venue.
  • His confirmation came during the Champions Trophy squad announcement.

  • He joined the Mumbai team for practice ahead of the match.

title: New bird flu vaccine development gathers pace amid fears of pandemic - The Times of India
summary:
New Bird Flu Vaccine Development Gathers Pace Amid Fears of Pandemic

Publication Date: [Publication Date] Source: Times of India

Amid fears of a bird flu pandemic in humans due to the rise in bird flu cases, the federal government is accelerating efforts in developing new vaccines, including mRNA shots, with a $590 million commitment to Moderna.

  • The US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) has intensified bird flu vaccine development.
  • An mRNA vaccine is being prioritized for its ability to be developed quickly.
  • $590 million has been committed to Moderna for fast-tracking vaccine production, in addition to a previous $176 million investment.
  • 67 confirmed human cases of bird flu have been reported in the US, with one death.
  • Research funding is also being allocated for antivirals and monoclonal antibodies to combat bird flu.
“Accelerating the development of new vaccines will allow us to stay ahead and ensure that Americans have the tools they need to stay safe.” - HHS Secretary Xavier Becerra

The development of new vaccines for bird flu is critical in ensuring public safety and preventing a potential pandemic, as current vaccines may not be sufficient during a health crisis.
newTitle: New Bird Flu Vaccine Development Gathers Pace Amid Fears of Pandemic

title: The Hindu Lit for Life 2025 Day 1 LIVE: ‘Sinauli excavations must answer Dalits’ role in Dravidian culture’, says Vasugi Bhaskar - The Hindu
summary:
The Hindu Lit for Life 2025 Day 1 LIVE: ‘Pre-marital sex is frowned upon but marital rape is legal’, says Leeza Mangaldas

Date: January 18, 2025
Source: The Hindu

The first day of The Hindu Lit for Life 2025 began with vibrant discussions featuring various authors and speakers addressing key societal issues. Notably, Leeza Mangaldas made headlines with her statements about marital rape and societal attitudes towards sex.

  • Leeza Mangaldas emphasized how pre-marital sex is frowned upon while marital rape remains legal in India.
  • Historian Peter Frankopan discussed the significance of the moon’s gravitational pull in human and animal reproduction.
  • Dr. Abraham Verghese highlighted the power of novels to transcend time.
  • Conversations included the influence of Tamil poetry in modernity, featuring insights from prominent literary figures.
  • Upcoming sessions are expected to cover diverse topics including literature, LGBTQ rights, and climate change.
“We live in a country where pre-marital sex is frowned upon, but marital rape is legal,” – Leeza Mangaldas.

The event presents an opportunity for deep engagement with contemporary issues, inviting audiences to rethink societal norms and values.
newTitle: The Hindu Lit for Life 2025 Day 1 Highlights: Controversial Discussions and Insights

India Open 2025 badminton: Danish shuttler criticises playing conditions as ‘not fair to anyone’, BAI says exploring alternative venues for future - The Indian Express
summary:
India Open 2025: Danish Shuttler Critiques Unfair Playing Conditions

Publication Date: January 18, 2025

Source: The Indian Express

Mia Blichfeldt, world No 23 from Denmark, has criticized the conditions at the India Open tournament in New Delhi, prompting the Badminton Association of India (BAI) to consider alternative venues for future events.

  • Conditions at the Indira Gandhi Indoor Stadium have been deemed unhealthy, contributing to player illness.
  • Blichfeldt fell ill for the second consecutive year during the tournament due to pollution and other factors.
  • The BAI is in discussions with the BWF to find better venues for future tournaments.
“It’s really hard to accept that many weeks of work and preparing, gets wasted because of bad conditions. It’s not fair to anyone…” - Mia Blichfeldt

The India Open continues to attract top global talent but faces significant logistic and health challenges that could impact its future.
newTitle: India Open 2025: Danish Shuttler Critiques Unfair Playing Conditions

title: NASA Posts Breathtaking Image Of Remnants Of Supernova - Free Press Journal
summary:
NASA Posts Breathtaking Image Of Remnants Of Supernova

Published on: Saturday, January 18, 2025, 06:44 PM IST

This article discusses a stunning new image released by NASA, showcasing the remnants of the supernova Cassiopeia A as captured by the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST).

  • The image is a result of JWST's capabilities to capture both visible and infrared light.
  • Cassiopeia A is the remnant of a massive star that exploded, creating a shockwave.
  • The image reveals details comparable to an onion's layers, as described by a member of the science team.
“We were pretty shocked to see this level of detail,” said Jacob Jencson of Caltech/IPAC, principal investigator.

This breathtaking image highlights NASA's ongoing efforts to explore and capture celestial wonders, showcasing the advancements of the JWST.
newTitle: NASA Posts Breathtaking Image Of Remnants Of Supernova

title: Rare meteorite strike sound captured on Canada home's doorbell camera | Watch viral video | Today News - Mint
summary:
Rare meteorite strike sound captured on Canada home’s doorbell camera | Watch viral video

Date: September 2023 | Source: Live Mint

A rare moment was captured on camera in Charlottetown City, Canada, when a rock from space fell to Earth. A doorbell camera on a Canadian home recorded the meteorite hitting Earth as it crashed into a walkway.

Key Points:

  • The incident occurred in July last year.
  • A couple returned home to find their walkway littered with debris.
  • The meteorite was confirmed to be of interstellar origins by the University of Alberta.
  • It marked a significant first in meteorite documentation with both video and sound.
  • The space rock has been named Charlottetown.
“As far as we know — it is the first time that a meteorite falling to Earth has been recorded on video, with sound,” said Chris Herd, geologist.

This unique event offers new insights into meteorite strikes and has generated significant interest.
newTitle: Rare meteorite strike sound captured on Canada home’s doorbell camera | Watch viral video

title: Arvind Kejriwal’s car attacked by BJP workers during campaigning, alleges AAP; BJP denies involvement - The Hindu
summary:
Kejriwal's Car Attacked by BJP Workers, Claims AAP

Date: January 18, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The AAP has alleged that Arvind Kejriwal’s car was attacked during an election campaign, claiming the attackers were BJP workers.

  • The AAP released a video showing a group of people waving black flags and throwing stones at Kejriwal's car.
  • BJP leader Parvesh Sahib Singh countered that the crowd was attempting to ask questions to Kejriwal, and some youths were injured by his vehicle.
  • Police stated that no stones were thrown at the car, and the individuals waving flags were swiftly removed.
“Supporters of BJP’s New Delhi candidate Parvesh Verma attacked Kejriwal during campaigning in the constituency,” an AAP leader said.

Concluding, this incident highlights the rising tensions and allegations between AAP and BJP amidst a charged political atmosphere.
newTitle: Kejriwal's Car Attacked by BJP Workers, Claims AAP

Is iron deficiency only cause of anaemia? New study reveals shocking details - The Financial Express
summary:
Is iron deficiency only cause of anaemia? New study reveals shocking details

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Financial Express

A recent study indicates that iron deficiency is not the sole cause of anaemia, with other contributors like low vitamin B12 and air pollution significantly impacting its prevalence.

  • The study analyzed data from a blood survey across eight Indian states.
  • It was published in the European Journal of Clinical Nutrition.
  • Only a third of anaemia cases were attributed to iron deficiency.
  • Researchers called for changes in public health policy regarding anaemia prevention.
  • Anaemia rates in the study were found to be lower than those reported in previous surveys.
“These results have policy implications for anaemia prevention and correction at the population level.”

The findings challenge previous assumptions regarding anaemia and suggest a need for urgent re-evaluation of strategies focused solely on iron deficiency.
newTitle: New Study Reveals Multiple Causes of Anaemia Beyond Iron Deficiency

title: Delhi Polls: Kejriwal Announces 'Gamechanger' Free Electricity, Water Scheme For Tenants - News18
summary:
Kejriwal Unveils Free Utilities Scheme for Tenants Ahead of Delhi Elections

Date: January 18, 2025 | Source: News18

With the Delhi Assembly elections approaching, Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) leader Arvind Kejriwal announced a significant policy guaranteeing free electricity and water for tenants, aiming to support his party's electoral campaign.

  • Kejriwal guaranteed free electricity and water for all tenants if AAP is re-elected.
  • The announcement is particularly aimed at benefiting Purvanchali residents, who represent a significant tenant population.
  • He emphasized the current inequalities faced by tenants who do not receive similar benefits as homeowners.
  • This announcement comes on the heels of BJP's manifesto release, pushing AAP to bolster their campaign promises.
“Across Delhi, we have provided free electricity and water to residents. However, it is unfortunate that tenants do not get these benefits.” — Arvind Kejriwal

This scheme reflects AAP's continued focus on welfare initiatives, especially for vulnerable communities as they seek to secure votes in the upcoming elections.
newTitle: Kejriwal Unveils Free Utilities Scheme for Tenants Ahead of Delhi Elections
